result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Niles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

and Order for Sentence Modification

Defendant William E Niles in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Thomas recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 1, Ct 2 will be DRI.  Court addresses DE on waiver of personal appearance for sentencing.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. DE will enter a plea of G, court will accept and adjuge the DE guilty.  Court will order sentence withheld, one year probation.  DE will pay CC, provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, DE will have 46 days credit.  DE to set up PP with DOC agent, supply DNA samplet immediately, continue current counseling and compley with DOC recommendations
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR.

Defendant William E Niles in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas appearing telephonic from Barron County.  Defendant William E Niles in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  MH for modification of bond.  Atty states argument for motion.  States response.  The court has reviewed prior court appearances, the court finds some cash bond is necessary, will reduce to $500.00 cash bond,  contact will be allowed with Ms Gruna while DE is incarcerated, no discussion of this case.  If released DE/victim may not reside together, no contact allowed.  Telephone contact will be allowed, or third person contact allowed.  Atty states an agreement has been reached.  Set for plea 12--05-16 @ 11:30AM, will set for a half hour.  Hearing will be via video conference.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Review hearing on November 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William E Niles in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  Defendant William E Niles in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Set for RH 11-15-16 @ 10:00AM.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond, asking for a sign bond or low cash bond for various reasons.  Victim has completed the Embrace program.  State opposes any bond modification.  Court will deny the motion for bond modification.  DE would like to exercise his right to substitute judge, court will take under advisement, forward to district court administrator for decision.
